string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
You must complete the question before submitting.
Enter your name in the field below:
You have reached the time limit set for the quiz. Press 'OK' to continue.

slidelink.displaytext: Module 1: The Standard and Basic Physics Principles
Activity 1: Who benefits if the load is secured properly?
Activity 2: Guiding Principle of Cargo Securement
Activity 4: Apply the Laws of Physics to Cargo Securement

search.slidetext: cargo securement module 1: the standard and basic physics principles start start start

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue good job! that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue drag and drop each benefit to the correct location. click the submit button when done. the driver the carrier the public benefits: feels safer keeps his job better safety record improved company image more confidence sharing the road with large trucks no time lost reloading improved road safety feels more confident about handling the vehicle less cargo damage reduced liability

drag and drop each benefit to the correct location. click the submit button when done. the driver the carrier the public incorrect. here are the correct answers. click next to continue. feels safer keeps his job no time lost reloading feels more confident about handling the vehicle better safety record improved company image reduced liability less cargo damage more confidence sharing the road with large trucks improved road safety

when? the cargo must remain secured on or in the transporting vehicle: under all conditions that could reasonably be expected to occur in normal driving. when a driver is responding in all emergency situations, except when there is a crash. what? cargo being transported on the highway must remain secured on or within the transporting vehicle. click each safety triangle to learn about the guiding principle of cargo securement. when when when when what

references for tiedowns that aren’t marked with a working load limit (wll). industry standards used when developing the north american cargo securement standard terms used in the standardexample: anchor point – part of the structure, fitting or attachment on a vehicle or cargo to which a tiedown is attached specific requirements for different types of cargo such as: light vehicles heavy equipment securement systems (anchor points, tiedowns, vehicle structures, dunnage, etc.) cargo placement inspections of cargo what vehicles are covered by the standard how the cargo must be contained, immobilized, and secured the cargo securement system and how strong it needs to be the standard is grouped into 6 parts. click each part to learn what it covers. section what it covers what vehicles are covered by the standard how the cargo must be contained, immobilized, and secured the cargo securement system and how strong it needs to be securement systems (anchor points, tiedowns, vehicle structures, dunnage, etc.) cargo placement inspections of cargo specific requirements for different types of cargo such as: light vehicles heavy equipment terms used in the standardexample: anchor point – part of the structure, fitting or attachment on a vehicle or cargo to which a tiedown is attached industry standards used when developing the north american cargo securement standard references for tiedowns that aren’t marked with a working load limit (wll). part 1: fundamentals of cargo securement part 1: fundamentals of cargo securement part 2: general provisions and requirements part 3: specific requirements by commodity type part 6: default working load limits for unmarked tie downs part 5: cargo securement components – referenced standards part 4: definitions

incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect. the correct answers are shown. correct continue continue continue continue continue continue advertise a specific company advertise a specific company advertise a specific company advertise a specific company advertise a specific company advertise a specific company blow off of vehicle blow off of vehicle blow off of vehicle blow off of vehicle blow off of vehicle blow off of vehicle fall from or through the vehicle fall from or through the vehicle fall from or through the vehicle fall from or through the vehicle fall from or through the vehicle fall from or through the vehicle become dislodged from vehicle become dislodged from vehicle become dislodged from vehicle become dislodged from vehicle become dislodged from vehicle become dislodged from vehicle shift upon or within vehicle so that vehicle’s stability or maneuverability is affected shift upon or within vehicle so that vehicle’s stability or maneuverability is affected shift upon or within vehicle so that vehicle’s stability or maneuverability is affected shift upon or within vehicle so that vehicle’s stability or maneuverability is affected shift upon or within vehicle so that vehicle’s stability or maneuverability is affected shift upon or within vehicle so that vehicle’s stability or maneuverability is affected if cargo is contained, immobilized, or secured properly, there are certain things that the cargo should not do. what are they? leak or spill leak or spill leak or spill leak or spill leak or spill leak or spill select the best answer(s) and then click the submit button.

incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue incorrect. there can be some movement if it doesn’t reduce the effectiveness of the securement system. correct continue continue continue continue continue continue correct. there can be some movement if it doesn’t reduce the effectiveness of the securement system. true true true true true true false false false false false false true or false? you can prevent all cargo from shifting. make a selection and click the submit button to check your answer.

incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue correct continue continue continue continue continue continue dislodges from the vehicle makes noise while driving shifts and makes the vehicle unstable shifts, reducing effectiveness of the system blocks view in rearview mirror drag and drop the correct responses. click the submit button to check your answers. you can tell if a cargo system has failed when the cargo does the following:

incorrect. the correct answers are shown. continue continue continue continue continue continue dislodges from the vehicle makes noise while driving shifts and makes the vehicle unstable shifts, reducing effectiveness of the system blocks view in rearview mirror drag and drop the correct responses. click the submit button to check your answers. you can tell if a cargo system has failed when the cargo does the following:

incorrect. the correct answers are shown. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct continue continue continue continue continue continue possible accident possible accident possible accident possible accident possible accident possible accident trip delay trip delay trip delay trip delay trip delay trip delay exciting trips exciting trips exciting trips exciting trips exciting trips exciting trips financial loss financial loss financial loss financial loss financial loss financial loss injury injury injury injury injury injury cargo damage cargo damage cargo damage cargo damage cargo damage cargo damage loss of load loss of load loss of load loss of load loss of load loss of load impact on motor carrier safety rating impact on motor carrier safety rating impact on motor carrier safety rating impact on motor carrier safety rating impact on motor carrier safety rating impact on motor carrier safety rating what are the consequences of an improperly secured load? slow travel slow travel slow travel slow travel slow travel slow travel select the best answer(s) and then click the submit button.

incorrect. the correct answers are shown. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct continue continue continue continue continue continue doors doors doors doors doors doors tarpaulins tarpaulins tarpaulins tarpaulins tarpaulins tarpaulins spare tire spare tire spare tire spare tire spare tire spare tire cargo securing equipment cargo securing equipment cargo securing equipment cargo securing equipment cargo securing equipment cargo securing equipment radio radio radio radio radio radio select the best answer(s) and then click the submit button. what portion of the commercial motor vehicle’s structure and equipment must be secured? tailgate tailgate tailgate tailgate tailgate tailgate

picture a truck traveling down a highway carrying cargo that is not secured to the vehicle. under normal driving conditions, there are a variety of situations that can occur that would create a force that would change the motion of the cargo. based on the situation, the cargo will shift in one of these directions: forward, rearward, sideways, upwards. forward rearward sideways upward

forward braking traveling downhill upwards hitting bumps and holes on the road sideways cornering changing lanes rearward acceleration braking in reverse shifting gears going uphill click on the arrows to learn more.

incorrect continue continue continue continue continue continue correct continue continue continue continue continue continue apply what you know about the laws of physics. drag and drop to match the conditions to the direction. click submit to check your answers. traveling downhill hitting bumps and holes acceleration braking in reverse shifting gears going uphill cornering changing lanes forward upward rearward sideways

apply what you know about the laws of physics. drag and drop to match the conditions to the direction. click submit to check your answers. traveling downhill hitting bumps and holes acceleration braking in reverse shifting gears going uphill cornering changing lanes forward upward rearward sideways incorrect. here are the correct answers. click next to continue. continue continue continue continue continue continue
